metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29991 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: Firefox incorrectly accepted a newline in a HTTP/3 header, interpretting it as two separate headers. This allowed for a header splitting attack against servers using HTTP/3. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 91.0.1 and Thunderbird < 91.0.1.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
